Joint Probability (1/2)
▪ How can we obtain the joint probability of X = (X1, X2, …, Xd), 
i.e., P(X) = P(X1, X2, …, Xd), using a Bayesian network?
– In general, P(X) = P(X1)P(X2|X1) P(X3|X1, X2)…P(Xd|X1, …, Xd-1)
▪ However, we can assume the following in Bayesian networks:
P(Xi|X1, X2, …, Xi-1) = P(Xi|parents(Xi)) 
– where parents(Xi) denotes the parents of Xi
– Local Markov property: a node is conditionally independent of its non-
descents given its parents
